questions: Q. 4. What is the role of saliva in the digestion of food ?
answers: Ans. Saliva moistens the ingested food with mucus, sterilises it with lysozyme and partially digests starch part of food into sugar with the help of salivary amylase or ptyalin.

questions: Q. 6. Where does digestion of fat takes place in our body ?
answers: Ans. Digestion of fats occur in duodenum and jejunum parts of small intestine with the help of enzyme lipase that acts on emulsified fat to form fatty acid and glycerol.

questions: Q. 7. State the location and the function of gastric glands ?
answers: Ans. Gastric glands are present in the wall of stomach which releases hydrochloric acid, mucus and protein digesting enzyme pepsin.

questions: Q. 8. What is the role of acid in our stomach ?
answers: Ans. HCl of gastric juice disinfects the food and acidifies it for proper functioning of proteolytic enzyme pepsin.

questions: Q. 9. State the function of digestive enzyme.
answers: Ans. Digestive enzyme are hydrolytic proteinaceous substances which cause breakdown of complex and insoluble components of food into simple, soluble and absorbable substances.

questions: Q. 10. Mention the site of complete digestion of carbohydrates, proteins and fats in humans.
answers: Ans. Small intestine in Alimentary canal.
